<rule id="azure-tas-binding-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <filecontent filename="{*}" pattern="{pattern}"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="potential" effort="3" title="Tanzu Application Service service bindings">
                    <message>
                        The application has configuration for VMware Tanzu Application Service (TAS) service bindings.
                        To migrate a Java application that uses TAS service bindings to Azure, you can follow these recommendations:
                        
                        * Examine the VCAP_SERVICES variable for configuration settings of external services bound to the application

                        * Consider using Service Connector to connect Azure compute services to other backing services. 
                        This service configures the network settings and connection information (for example, generating environment variables) between compute services and target backing services in management plane.                   
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?pivots=sc-enterprise-tier#resources-configured-through-vmware-tanzu-application-service-tas-formerly-pivotal-cloud-foundry" title="Java to Azure migration: resources configured through TAS"/>
                    <link href="https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/devguide/deploy-apps/environment-variable.html#VCAP-SERVICES" title="TAS (Cloud Foundry) environment variable: VCAP_SERVICES"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/service-connector/overview" title="What is Service Connector"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/service-connector/quickstart-portal-spring-cloud-connection?toc=%2Fazure%2Fspring-apps%2Ftoc.json&bc=%2Fazure%2Fspring-apps%2Fbreadcrumb%2Ftoc.json" title="Create a service connection in Azure Spring Apps from the Azure portal"/>
                </hint>
            </perform>
            <where param="pattern">
                <matches pattern="\W(VCAP_SERVICES)\W"/>
            </where>
        </rule>
